caseProcess.description: The Summerville Police Department received reports of multiple theft incidents attributed to the defendant, Q. White, leading to the formal case filing and initiation of investigation procedures.
Law enforcement officers conducted a search at Q. White’s residence, resulting in the discovery of stolen goods and immediate detention measures being applied.
Q. White was formally placed under criminal detention following initial interrogation and collection of preliminary evidence.
An official arrest warrant was issued by Summerville, Franklin, Court, and Q. White was taken into lawful custody.

details.behavior: Q. White entered SuperShop Mart multiple times, concealing various high-value electronics under her clothing.
details.evidence: Surveillance footage from SuperShop Mart capturing Q. White’s actions; written statements from store employees; inventory discrepancies corresponding to the stolen items.

details.behavior: Using a fake ID, Q. White purchased jewelry worth $5,000 from Jewel Haven and paid with a stolen credit card.
details.evidence: Transaction records from Jewel Haven; stolen credit card reported by the cardholder; ID verification discrepancy noted in store logs.

details.behavior: Q. White broke into a residence at 45, Bluejay Avenue, stealing valuable artwork and cash totaling $10,000.
details.evidence: Witness testimony from neighbors; fingerprints lifted from the crime scene; photographs of the stolen artwork found in Q. White’s residence.

judgmentResult.sentence: 4 years of fixed-term imprisonment and a fine of $20,000.
judgmentResult.sentencingConsiderations: The court considered the series of thefts, the total amount stolen exceeding significant thresholds, and the defendant’s repeated offenses.

legalProcedure.probation: No probation applicable as the crimes involve particularly serious circumstances, including high-value theft and repeated offenses.
